Status Subject: Aldo expline bout the product prodaction
Action Details:
Hello,

no of course not, 45 days is the lead-time we need from the order to have the goods done and ready but it is not the actual time we take to manufacture.

I try to explain and I am referring to the milk-free product.
First, we produce the whole quantity of ordered spread itself (bulk) and store it in a dedicated tank;
this would take approx 3-4 days because that line does not work 24h.
Then, in a second moment, we pack the spread all at once in the jars and this task will take less than one day.

The procedure for the standard spread is very similar, but faster because the production is higher and the plant runs 24h

Action Details:
Leading on from our discussions earlier please see below the pricing for the 2.5KG size. I have quoted for the Ardo brand but it is expected to be in Shufersal PL.

Once you have a clearer view of timings and volumes we can look to progress.

 

Please see below the key milestones & next steps Jonathan has previously communicated.

 

NEXT PROJECT STEPS:

-We are currently running an internal reviewing process where the 7 selected products are evaluated and approved for new private label launch by different departments and decision makers. We are expecting an outcome on this internal evaluation process soon.

-A next step will be for Ardo to determine the bag dimensions for each of the 7 products, and to share our technical drawings or dielines with you.

-Then the customer will have to (re-)built their graphics on our technical drawings, and send us a draft version for revision and approval.

-Once the draft versions of the artworks are approved, the customer can send us the full print files (e.g. via Wetransfer) upon which we can initiate the production of the printing plates.

-Once that is done, our film supplier will receive the printing plates and start printing the 7 films.

-As soon as these films are printed and delivered to our Ardo factories, we can start with a first packing run for each of them, and then start shipping the first containers to Israel.

 

Depending on how quick we can finish each of the above steps, this entire launch process will take at least 3 months, potentially more.

Just so you understand that sending us the first PO’s later this month will be a bit too early in the process.

 

So we’ll soon send you our technical drawings = dielines for the 7 products, upon which the customer can work on the artwork.
